text:
From Paul, Silas, and Timothy.
To the church at Thessalonica united with God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.
speaker: Narrator

text: Good will  and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ are yours!
speaker: Narrator

text: We always have to thank God for you, brothers and sisters. It’s right to do this because your faith is showing remarkable growth and your love for each other is increasing.
speaker: Narrator

text: That’s why we brag in God’s churches about your endurance and faith in all the persecutions and suffering you are experiencing.
speaker: Narrator

text: Your suffering proves that God’s judgment is right and that you are considered worthy of his kingdom.
speaker: Narrator

text: Certainly, it is right for God to give suffering to those who cause you to suffer.
speaker: Narrator

text: It is also right for God to give all of us relief from our suffering. He will do this when the Lord Jesus is revealed, coming from heaven with his mighty angels in a blazing fire.
speaker: Narrator

text: He will take revenge on those who refuse to acknowledge God and on those who refuse to respond to the Good News about our Lord Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: They will pay the penalty by being destroyed forever, by being separated from the Lord’s presence and from his glorious power.
speaker: Narrator

text: This will happen on that day when he comes to be honored among all his holy people and admired by all who have believed in him. This includes you because you believed the testimony we gave you.
speaker: Narrator

text: With this in mind, we always pray that our God will make you worthy of his call. We also pray that through his power he will help you accomplish every good desire and help you do everything your faith produces.
speaker: Narrator

text: That way the name of our Lord Jesus will be honored among you. Then, because of the good will of Jesus Christ, our God and Lord, you will be honored by him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Brothers and sisters, we have this request to make of you about our Lord Jesus Christ’s coming and our gathering to meet him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Don’t get upset right away or alarmed when someone claims that we said through some spirit, conversation, or letter that the day of the Lord has already come.
speaker: Narrator

text: Don’t let anyone deceive you about this in any way. That day cannot come unless a revolt takes place first, and the man of sin, the man of destruction, is revealed.
speaker: Narrator

text: He opposes every so-called god or anything that is worshiped and places himself above them, sitting in God’s temple and claiming to be God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Don’t you remember that I told you about these things when I was still with you?
speaker: Narrator

text: You know what it is that now holds him back, so that he will be revealed when his time comes.
speaker: Narrator

text: The mystery of this sin is already at work. But it cannot work effectively until the person now holding it back gets out of the way.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the man of sin will be revealed and the Lord Jesus will destroy him by what he says. When the Lord Jesus comes, his appearance will put an end to this man.
speaker: Narrator

text: The man of sin will come with the power of Satan. He will use every kind of power, including miraculous and wonderful signs. But they will be lies.
speaker: Narrator

text: He will use everything that God disapproves of to deceive those who are dying, those who refused to love the truth that would save them.
speaker: Narrator

text: That’s why God will send them a powerful delusion so that they will believe a lie.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then everyone who did not believe the truth, but was delighted with what God disapproves of, will be condemned.
speaker: Narrator

text: We always have to thank God for you, brothers and sisters. You are loved by the Lord and we thank God that in the beginning he chose you to be saved through a life of spiritual devotion and faith in the truth.
speaker: Narrator

text: With this in mind he called you by the Good News which we told you so that you would obtain the glory of our Lord Jesus Christ.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then, brothers and sisters, firmly hold on to the traditions we taught you either when we spoke to you or in our letter.
speaker: Narrator

text: God our Father loved us and by his kindness  gave us everlasting encouragement and good hope. Together with our Lord Jesus Christ,
speaker: Narrator

text: may he encourage and strengthen you to do and say everything that is good.
speaker: Narrator

text: Finally, brothers and sisters, pray that we spread the Lord’s word rapidly and that it will be honored the way it was among you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also pray that we may be rescued from worthless and evil people, since not everyone shares our faith.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the Lord is faithful and will strengthen you and protect you against the evil one.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord gives us confidence that you are doing and will continue to do what we ordered you to do.
speaker: Narrator

text: May the Lord direct your lives as you show God’s love and Christ’s endurance.
speaker: Narrator

text: Brothers and sisters, in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ we order you not to associate with any believer who doesn’t live a disciplined life and doesn’t follow the tradition you received from us.
speaker: Narrator

text: You know what you must do to imitate us. We lived a disciplined life among you.
speaker: Narrator

text: We didn’t eat anyone’s food without paying for it. Instead, we worked hard and struggled night and day in order not to be a burden to any of you.
speaker: Narrator

text: It’s not as though we didn’t have a right to receive support. Rather, we wanted to set an example for you to follow.
speaker: Narrator

text: While we were with you, we gave you the order: “Whoever doesn’t want to work shouldn’t be allowed to eat.”
speaker: Narrator

text: We hear that some of you are not living disciplined lives. You’re not working, so you go around interfering in other people’s lives.
speaker: Narrator

text: We order and encourage such people by the Lord Jesus Christ to pay attention to their own work so they can support themselves.
speaker: Narrator

text: Brothers and sisters, we can’t allow ourselves to get tired of doing what is right.
speaker: Narrator

text: It may be that some people will not listen to what we say in this letter. Take note of them and don’t associate with them so that they will feel ashamed.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yet, don’t treat them like enemies, but instruct them like brothers and sisters.
speaker: Narrator

text: May the Lord of peace give you his peace at all times and in every way. The Lord be with all of you.
speaker: Narrator

text: I, Paul, am writing this greeting with my own hand. In every letter that I send, this is proof that I wrote it.
speaker: Narrator

text: The good will  of our Lord Jesus Christ be with all of you.
speaker: Narrator
